page.title: 02HACKLINGE AREA LANDSCAPE
page.content:
The landscape is flat and open with occasional pockets of deciduous woodland. The main Sandwich-Deal road runs diagonally from northwest to southeast. The land east of the road is cultivated polderland reaching the shore line at Sandwich Bay, the main waterway is the Delf Stream running into the River Stour at Sandwich. The land rises up to the road and drops away on the west to marsh-fenland watered by the North and South Streams. It rises as arable farmland to the highest point south of Ham. A slagheap consisting of waste from the coalmine at Betteshanger covers a large part of the southeast corner. It has recently been landscaped and a new drainage lake has been constructed on its southern side.
